fr:mainmatter.fr:p: The mixed Hodge structure of \operatorname {H}^\bullet (X_\bullet ,\mathbb {Z}) is the one defined above.

fr:title.text: Hodge Theory III › Hodge theory of algebraic spaces › Hodge theory of simplicial schemes

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Hodge Theory III › Hodge theory of algebraic spaces › Hodge theory of simplicial schemes

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: For reduced \overline {Z}_\bullet , we can consider j as a simplicial object in the category \mathscr {C} of pairs (Y,\overline {Y}) consisting of a proper reduced scheme \overline {Y} and a dense (Zariski) open Y of \overline {Y}. The category \mathscr {C} satisfies , which allows us to apply the analogue of .

html:ol.html:li: For every separated simplicial scheme X_\bullet , there exists a diagram of the form that satisfies (a) and (b), and such that \overline {Z}_\bullet is smooth and proper, and Z_\bullet is the complement of a normal crossing divisor.

Let F\colon {X_\bullet }_1\to {X_\bullet }_2 be a morphism of separated simplicial schemes. Let ({X_\bullet }_i,{Z_\bullet }_i,{\overline {Z}_\bullet }_i)_{i=1,2} be diagrams of the form that satisfy (a) and (b). Then there exists ({X_\bullet }_1,Z_\bullet ,\overline {Z}_\bullet ) as in (i), and a commutative diagram
\usepackage {amsmath} \usepackage {amssymb} \usepackage {tikz-cd} \begin {tikzcd} Z_\bullet \ar [r,hook] \ar [d] \ar [drr] & \overline {Z}_\bullet \ar [d] \ar [drr] \\{Z_\bullet }_1 \ar [r,hook,swap,"j_1"] \ar [d,swap,"p_1"] & {\overline {Z}_\bullet }_1 & {Z_\bullet }_2 \ar [r,hook,swap,"j_2"] \ar [d,swap,"p_2"] & {\overline {Z}_\bullet }_2 \\{X_\bullet }_1 \ar [rr,"f"] && {X_\bullet }_2 \end {tikzcd}

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: The proof, which is a more complicated analogue of , is left to the reader.
The mixed Hodge structure of \operatorname {H}^\bullet (X_\bullet ,\mathbb {Z}) is the one defined above.
It follows from (ii) of that this mixed Hodge structure is functorial in X_\bullet .

Let X_\bullet be a separated simplicial scheme. Then the spectral sequence E_1^{pq} = \operatorname {H}^q(X_p,\mathbb {Z}) \Rightarrow \operatorname {H}^{p+q}(X_\bullet ,\mathbb {Z}) is a spectral sequence of mixed Hodge structures.

For a diagram as in , the maps p_n\colon Z_n\to X_n are proper and surjective. We can thus apply to the category of simplicial objects in the category \mathscr {C} () to obtain, as in , the following lemma:

Let X_\bullet be a simplicial scheme, not necessarily separated. Then there exists a separated simplicial scheme Y_\bullet and u\colon Y_\bullet \to X_\bullet such that, for n\geq 0, the map u'_n\colon Y_n\to (\operatorname {cosq}_{n-1}^{X_\bullet }\operatorname {sq}_{n-1}Y_\bullet )_n is étale and surjective (for example, the sum of opens of an open cover).
